Title: When a Patch Goes Bad: Exploring the Properties of Vulnerability-Contributing Commits
Published: 2013 ACM/IEEE International Symposium on Empirical Software Engineering and Measurement
TTV_SZZ: Yes(they trust in finding the true fix-inducing)
Elements_risk_assessment: They use SZZ as is described in the article, using git blame to see which was the last commit touched the fixed line
UseOF-SZZ: They used the SZZ algorithm to blame the previous commit
Summary: The goal is answer: What  could  developers  have  looked  for to  identify  security  concerns  in  this  commit?; the objective is to improve software security by exploring code churn and other socio-technical properties of a VCCs. They used the sintaxis  VCCs to refer to a subset  of  what  other researchers have dubbed “fix-inducing” commits.
